main event: A circular silver object was sighted on 12 Aug 1948 at an altitude of 20,000-40,000+ feet, traveling southwest. The object was later determined to be Venus based on theodolite readings.
interesting points: The sighting occurred over a period of nearly four hours, from 11:30 AM to 3:24 PM EST.
The object was described as circular and silver in color, with no specific details on its surface features.
The altitude of the object is notably high, ranging from 20,000 to over 40,000 feet.
The direction of travel was noted as southwest, indicating a specific flight path.
The report mentions the use of theodolite readings to determine that the object was Venus, implying a scientific and thorough approach to the investigation.
